title: Ticket #7226: config auto use metaknob
description:
For the config system, it would be useful to be able to specify a metaknob that is always appended to the config, but only when some other knob is not defined. A new knob pattern will be used to enable this

AUTO_USE_<category>_<tag>

The value of this knob will be evaluated as a config if expression, and if it evaluates to true, then configuration will behave as if

use <category> : <tag>

Was appended to the configuration.

So, for example, if condor_config contains 

condor_config fragment
AUTO_USE_ROLE_SingleNodePool = ! defined DAEMON_LIST
AUTO_USE_SECURITY_TrustLocalAdmin = ! defined ALLOW_WRITE

Then once all of the config files had been parsed, the configuration would be check to see if DAEMON_LIST was defined, and if it not would load use ROLE:SingleNodePool, and it would check to see if ALLOW_WRITE was defined, and if not, it would load use SECURITY:TrustLocalAdmin

Here are the example metaknobs for use in the above statements. Note that these are suggested metaknobs, they are not actually in param_info.in 

param_info.in fragment
[$ROLE.SingleNodePool]
description=Automatic default role when no DAEMON_LIST is specified
default: @end
    DAEMON_LIST = COLLECTOR NEGOTIATOR SCHEDD STARTD
    CONDOR_HOST = $(IP_ADDRESS)
    if ! $(CondorIsAdmin)
       # use a dynamic port for non-rootly condor
       COLLECTOR_HOST = $(CONDOR_HOST):0
       # Windows needs a unique name for the procd pipe
       PROCD_ADDRESS = \\.\pipe\condor_procd_pipe_$(USERNAME)
    endif
@end

[$SECURITY.TrustUser]
description=Authorization policy based on user accounts - args(admin_username, condor_username)
       if ! $(2?)
         error : use SECURITY:TrustUser requires 2 arguments, an admin username, and a condor daemon username
       endif
       ALLOW_ADMINISTRATOR=$(1)@$(UID_DOMAIN) $(2)@$(UID_DOMAIN)
       ALLOW_OWNER=$(1)@$(UID_DOMAIN) $(2)@$(UID_DOMAIN)
       ALLOW_READ=*
       # allow_write used only by schedd for job submission
       ALLOW_WRITE=*
       ALLOW_DAEMON=$(2)@$(UID_DOMAIN)
       ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR=$(2)@$(UID_DOMAIN)
       ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR_SCHEDD=$(ALLOW_NEGOTIATOR) $(FLOCK_NEGOTIATOR_HOSTS)
       ALLOW_WRITE_COLLECTOR=$(ALLOW_WRITE) $(FLOCK_FROM)
       ALLOW_WRITE_STARTD=$(ALLOW_WRITE) $(FLOCK_FROM)
       ALLOW_READ_COLLECTOR=$(ALLOW_READ) $(FLOCK_FROM)
       ALLOW_READ_STARTD=$(ALLOW_READ) $(FLOCK_FROM)
@end

[$SECURITY.TrustLocalAdmin]
description=Security policy to trust only local administrator and condor itself
usage=Use for single node pool when HTCondor is running as a service that and can impersonate users
default=use Security : TrustUser(root, condor)
win32_default=use Security : TrustUser(Administrator, LOCAL_SYSTEM)
